intro: Fumana glutinosa f. genuina, commonly known as the sticky fumana, is a botanical variant of the species Fumana glutinosa. It is characterized by its sticky secretions on the leaves and stems, which are produced by specialized glandular structures. The plant belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is native to certain regions of Europe. Its morphology features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. This subspecies is often found in moist, calcareous soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
